formatted_address: 1220 ECP, #01-27 East Coast Lagoon Food Village, Singapore 468960
name: Sangtawan Sunny Thai

reviews.text: Ever since I discovered this gem a couple of weeks ago, I couldn‚Äôt resist returning for more. The deep-fried sea bass with Thai sauce is a standout‚Äîcrispy on the outside and  tender inside. We prefer the sauce on the side as the sauce is rather spicy. The moo ping is another highlight, succulent and perfectly grilled. This spot is my new go-to for Thai food!

This is the best Thai hawker stall on the East Coast by far. The service from Mr Tan is very friendly and if like me you're a vegetarian he will help you out with a delicious veggie curry. My fave is the vegetarian Thai green curry, very affordable, with a big and welcome spiciness from the chillies, cooked in a yummy sauce, and it only costs $6.80 for a meal with rice that'll fill you up nicely.

Very delicious authentic Thai food. Tastes like in Thailand.

I particularly like green curry chicken with rice and stir fried kang kong with shrimps. The shrimps are large and fresh.

The boss is very polite and welcoming.

Dapao-ed their food to picnic at ECP. Love their vermicelli salad. I‚Äôm not one to love salad but their vermicelli salad taste amazing. Would be back to try more of their other food! Portion is really big too!

We often enjoy dinner in the food village from different stalls. We eat a lot of Thai food and recently tried out a few dishes from Sunny Thai. Beside the extreme care and friendliness of the person taking the orders, I would like to point out how fresh and delicious each dish is. From Seafood pineapple rice to noodles everything is cooked with care. Yesterday I tried an entire fried fish and was surprised by its deliciousness. We surely will come back to try more items on the menu üëçüèª

vicinity: 1220 East Coast Parkway, #01-27 East Coast Lagoon Food Village
